DOC.brief_summary: The main objective is to evaluate the safety/tolerability and efficacy of YHD001 compared to singulair or placebo in patients (n=96) with partially controlled asthma. The study will conduct with 4 comparative groups orally treated with YHD001 dose level 1(t.i.d.), YHD001 dose level 2(t.i.d.), singulair 10mg(q.d.) or Placebo for 8 weeks.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of YHD001 in Asthma
DOC.criteria: Provision of signed written informed consent Acceptable medical history, physical exam,laboratory tests and EKG, during screening Nonsmoking (for longer than 1 year) patients with asthma Reversible airways obstruction (an increase in FEV1 absolute value of 12% or greater) 20 to 30 minutes after inhalation of bâˆ’agonist FEV1 between 50% and 85% of the predicted value (withholding shortacting, inhaled b2adrenergic agonist for 6 hours) History of any clinically significant disease History of drug/chemical/alcohol abuse Active upper respiratory tract infection within 3 weeks, emergency room treatment for asthma within 1 month, or hospitalization for asthma within 3 months of the prestudy visit
